image.altText: An older woman with short white hair sits in a living room looking serious.

props.synopsis: From today Canberrans like Gail Ford will be able to apply for the ACT's new voluntary assisted dying scheme, which its advocates say gives dignity in death to applicants.

title.children: Gail wants the choice to 'die with dignity'. From today she can

image.altText: Disability car parks are behind fences with with no access signs on them.

props.synopsis: Patients with mobility issues are struggling to visit medical professionals after the Theatre Lane car park closed for the construction of the Lyric Theatre.

title.children: Disability parking closure leaves Canberra patients searching for options

image.altText: A koala holds onto a tree branch while looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: A hidden group of koalas is found for the first time in a remote area of the New South Wales Snowy Mountains.

title.children: 'Incredibly exciting': Thermal drones detect hidden koala cluster

image.altText: Leanne Castley in the Legislative Assembly.

props.synopsis: After suspending two backbenchers from her party room this week, Canberra Liberals leader Leanne Castley has been silent. And it's hard to see how staying silent is helping Canberrans build trust in her party and her as the ACT's alternative chief minister.

title.children: Silence from Canberra Liberals leader only making a bad situation worse

image.altText: A football player with long dark hair wearing a green jersey, surrounded by players from another team, looks over his shoulder.

props.synopsis: Charges against Canberra Raiders prop Josh Papalii have been permanently stayed after it was revealed police had been discussing the case in a group chat on encrypted messaging service Signal.

title.children: Police group chat stops case against Canberra Raiders star Josh Papalii

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: After a severe car accident, the victim spent a year recovering in hospital. Then one day he discovered his bank account was empty.

title.children: Man sentenced after emptying quadriplegic friend's bank account

image.altText: An older couple, smiling, sitting on a couch, with arms around one another.

props.synopsis: Specialised accommodation will be built in Curtin to house those living with the nation's deadliest disease.

title.children: Canberra is a step closer to getting its first dementia care village

image.altText: A tradie buying and renovating homes at a home inspection.

props.synopsis: Australia's property market is heating up again, with record auctions over spring, and the return of both first home buyers and investors pushing up house prices.

title.children: First-time buyers turning to cheaper investments

image.altText: Shafali Verma runs off in celebration towards Harmanpreet Kaur

props.synopsis: All-round performances from Deepti Sharma and Shafali Verma have led India to a breakthrough World Cup triumph against South Africa in Navi Mumbai.

title.children: India claims maiden World Cup title with epic victory over South Africa

image.altText: A dimly lit pokies room with bright colourful lights coming from each of the machines.

props.synopsis: There are calls for football teams to distance themselves from poker machines after data found more than $110 million was lost at venues owned by football clubs and leagues in the last financial year.

title.children: Each day, these football-owned poker machines rake in more than $300k

image.altText: An armed guard standing outside the glass entrance to the Louvre.

props.synopsis: Four thieves raided the world's most-visited art museum last month, in broad daylight, taking just seven minutes to steal jewellery worth an estimated $150 million before fleeing on scooters.

title.children: Louvre heist suspects believed to be small-time criminals

image.altText: A fireman holding a hose and putting out a fire in a charred building.

props.synopsis: At least two people have been killed in a drone attack in Ukraine's south-western Odesa region, and Kyiv has stepped up its attacks on Russia's oil industry.

title.children: Russian drones kill Ukrainians and Kyiv targets Moscow's oil

image.altText: A row of wooden pillars stands in the middle of a field with wrecked building materials lying inside.

props.synopsis: Dozens of wedding guests rushed to shelter children under tables and hold up the walls of a reception hall during an intense storm in Queensland's Banana Shire over the weekend.

title.children: Wedding guests shelter under tables as storm tears roof from historic hall

image.altText: Canavan speaks in a courtyard surrounded by a crowd of politicians.

props.synopsis: The Nationals have formally abandoned a commitment to reach net zero emissions by 2050, setting a challenge for Opposition leader Sussan Ley whether to follow or risk splitting the Coalition.

title.children: 'Found our voice': Nationals abandon net zero by 2050 climate promise

image.altText: an artists's illustration of a redesign of sydney's glebe island bridge

props.synopsis: Beneath Sydney's Anzac Bridge lies a lesser-known, heritage-listed landmark that has been dormant for three decades.

title.children: Renewed push to revive historic 'old swing bridge' sitting idle for 30 years

image.altText: A jockey looks to his right and smiles as he rides his horse towards the line in the Melbourne Cup.

props.synopsis: From quiet beginnings, an unknown English filly came Down Under and changed Australia's racing history by achieving the impossible. This is how Makybe Diva won a historic third Melbourne Cup, 20 years ago.

title.children: 'A champion becomes a legend': Makybe Diva's 'impossible' third Cup win

image.altText: A young woman prepares to do a snatch lift, she has a strained look on her face.

props.synopsis: Teenager Mira Mohan, and Francee and Carolyn, both in their 60s, are changing the face of weightlifting, showing it is a sport for women at any stage of life.

title.children: Weightlifting empowers women of all ages to stop feeling 'invisible'

image.altText: Man with blonde hair wearing one earring.

props.synopsis: A man charged with the domestic violence murder of 39-year-old Hunter woman Rhukaya Lake is remanded in custody.

title.children: Man refused bail over accused murder of woman near Cessnock

image.altText: Father and son celebrate after finishing yacht race.

props.synopsis: It has been almost 20 years since Ken Gourlay became the fastest Australian to sail solo, non-stop and unassisted around the world. Now, his son is aiming to break the record.

title.children: Dad's words of wisdom to son ahead of solo around the world sail

image.altText: Mojito mocktail

props.synopsis: Having a range of drinks on offer can help everyone feel included, especially at end-of-year gatherings.

title.children: Raise a glass to these easy low and no-alcohol drinks

image.altText: four climbers on belay while two are on the rock face. all wearing colourful helmets.

props.synopsis: Rock climbers are publicly urging others to ignore Parks Victoria's requests to avoid culturally significant routes at Mount Arapiles Dyurrite in western Victoria.

title.children: 'Keep climbing': Defiance grows over Mount Arapiles cultural requests

image.altText: Kirsha Kaechele

props.synopsis: No men are allowed at Kirsha Kaechele's Ladies Lounge and the Supreme Court agrees. The artist, curator and "missus" of MONA's owner knows how to cross boundaries, but can she solve Tasmania's thorniest dispute?

title.children: Why the 'first lady' of MONA has always felt like an outsider

image.altText: A side-on court sketch of David Pye, showing him with a beard, bald head, ponytail and neck tattoos.

props.synopsis: With all the hallmarks of a Hollywood blockbuster, the high-profile murder trial of ex-bikie David Pye in WA's Supreme Court was never going to be a pedestrian affair.

title.children: How a Perth FIFO worker became a trained assassin who publicly executed a bikie

image.altText: Children's toys including a giraffe inside a car and an abacus.

props.synopsis: The decision by past governments to push Australia's childcare industry in the direction of marketisation and corporatisation has left a lasting legacy.

title.children: Australia's scandal-ridden childcare sector a legacy of 'golden age' of reform

image.altText: Person waiting at lights on an fat tyre ebike

props.synopsis: Noticing a lot of e-bikes around lately? Here's a state-by-state breakdown of the laws about them.

title.children: What is the difference between an e-bike and an e-motorbike?

image.altText: A close up of a cluster of small yellow flowers, a green landscape is in the background.

props.synopsis: There are signs a critically endangered plant that grows on a rural property near Armidale could have a prosperous future.

title.children: Endangered plant that grows only in one place shows signs of flourishing

image.altText: Graphic of two women on public transport scrolling phones and images from one phone turn up on another

props.synopsis: Armed with a burner phone and a fake name, I set out to learn how Instagram’s algorithm really works. This is what happened next.

title.children: I tried to outsmart the social media algorithm. Here's how it outsmarted me

image.altText: A red truck with a donga on the back, the donga appears ajar on the trailer. Orange tape blocks off the scene.

props.synopsis: A worker in his 60s has died after sustaining critical injuries on a property in South Kalgoorlie.

title.children: Man dies after worksite incident in WA's Goldfields

image.altText: A koala holds onto a tree branch while looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: A hidden group of koalas is found for the first time in a remote area of the New South Wales Snowy Mountains.

title.children: 'Incredibly exciting': Thermal drones detect hidden koala cluster

image.altText: Rugby league player down on one knee, puff and bleeding eye, attened by a trainer

props.synopsis: Tongan forward Eliesa Katoa has been fitted with an oxygen mask during the Pacific Championship Test match against New Zealand, after copping multiple blows to the head.

title.children: NRL star fitted with oxygen mask on sideline of Tonga-New Zealand Test

image.altText: An edited image showing a horse removed from the picture during the Melbourne Cup.

props.synopsis: For years, the racing industry has been quietly removing falls and deaths from its replays. Now, industry insiders are speaking out.

title.children: How racing makes its deadliest moments disappear

image.altText: A graphic of playing cards falling through a basketball net

props.synopsis: The New York mafia is alive and an "historic" FBI bust has shown that underworld crime is still kicking across the United States.

title.children: New York's underbelly is thriving — this FBI case pulled back the curtain

image.altText: Blue and white police tape.

props.synopsis: Two people have been killed in fatal crashes across the Riverina just hours apart.

title.children: Police ask for help after body found in burnt-out ute

image.altText: Dozens of tents pitched on the foreshore with the ocean waves in the background.

props.synopsis: Hamas says it offered to hand over samples of the unidentified bodies, but Israel refused and asked for the remains for examination.

title.children: Three bodies returned by Hamas are not those of hostages, Israel says

image.altText: A sign reading Yatala Labour Prison behind blurred greenery

props.synopsis: A prisoner was taken to the hospital after the second alleged violent assault in two weeks in the South Australian prison system.

title.children: Nine prisoners attacked inmate in latest SA prison assault, union says
